title.text: A Critical Reassessment of Evaluation Baselines for Speech Summarization

abstractContent.text: We assess the current state of the art in speech summarization, by comparing atypical sum-marizer on two different domains: lecture data and the SWITCHBOARD corpus.

Our results cast significant doubt on the merits of this area's accepted evaluation standards in terms of: baselines chosen, the correspondence of results to our intuition of what "summaries" should be, and the value of adding speech-related features to summarizers that already use transcripts from automatic speech recognition (ASR) systems.
